messages.original: Russian artillery shelling is now targeting Kherson, after the ballistic missile strike. A reconnaissance drone is operating there too.

I've said this about "leaks" supposedly showing Ukrainian casualties, and I'll say it about these ones too:
A sheet of paper claiming to show something, without any form of proof, is not evidence of 282,000 Russian casualties in 2025. This, just like the ones about Ukraine, just seem like part of the information war. 
If you believe this "leak", but not leaks about Ukrainian casualties, you are delusional.

Russian forces have captured the village of Fedorivka, southern flank of Siversk, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~410. 
Total land area: ~0.94 km¬≤.

On this day, 2 years ago, one of the world's most heavily armed guerilla armies, alongside several other militant factions, launched an invasion of Israel from the Gaza Strip. Approximately 6,000 rockets were launched in the first week of the war, completely overwhelming one of the world's strongest air defence networks, while hundreds of hostages were taken back into Gaza. Over 1,000 Israelis were killed, in an effort not only targeting the Israeli military, but also as many civilians as possible.
Two years later, tens of thousands of Palestinian civilians lie dead, in a genocide and ethnic cleansing that is only just beginning to be recognised. Most buildings in the Gaza Strip have either been flattened or are heavily damaged. The health sector continues to operate at a bare minimum due to constant attacks and restraints on aid and fuel. 
Hamas and its allied factions are a shadow of their former selves. Incredibly degraded from constant Israeli attacks, most of their original fighters are dead, wounded, or captured, with untrained and young recruits making up the majority of their ranks. 
But arguably the most significant events that resulted from this surprise attack was the spillover. Israel has since attacked Lebanon, Syria, Iran, the West Bank, and Qatar, resulting in rising tensions across the region, and the beginning of a systematic (and successful) effort at dismantling Iran's "axis of resistance", which now lies in ruin. 
On the other hand, Israel's image on the world stage has changed drastically. 20 new countries have recognised a Palestinian state, while widespread condemnation and global awareness was brought to Israel, and Israel's actions. 
Today, peace negotiations are once again underway, despite failures in all the previous ones. Even if Israel secures what they want in Gaza, it will be interesting to see if this will have any effect on the events to follow.
A before and after of Northern Gaza, two years since October 7.
Correction: The explosion occurred in Vilnyansk, Zaporizhzhia Oblast

The near-exact trajectory of the Iskander-M ballistic missile. 
Vilnyansk was targeted by long-range Smerch/Tornado-S MLRS yesterday.

Russian forces have captured the village of Novovasylivske, Hulyaipole direction, Zaporizhzhia Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~73.
Total land area: ~0.33 km¬≤.

@Middle_East_Spectator

Those high rise buildings in Pokrovsk are not only still in decent condition and positions can be estabilished there, but they also have very good basements below them where they can hide extremely effectively and accumulate safely.
Civilians still remaining in the city are also a big problem, as there are cases where they help hide Russian soldiers.
So, if they were to gain a stable foothold in Shakhtarsky, it would be very hard to knock them out of there

Those high rise buildings in Pokrovsk are not only still in decent condition and positions can be estabilished there, but they also have very good basements below them where they can hide extremely effectively and accumulate safely. Civilians still remaining‚Ä¶

By the sounds of it, there is a fairly large grey zone in southern Pokrovsk. Most of Lazurnyi District is under Russian control, but Shakhtarskyi and Sonyachnyy Districts are mixed. 
The current Russian foothold is not critical for the Ukrainians, but rather the infiltration of units further north towards the highway is. If those groups can be eliminated in the coming days, then the situation will greatly improve for Ukraine. Otherwise, the Russians will be able to made much more progress through the high-rise blocks and begin clearing the low-rise residential areas towards the city centre.

Genuinely, why is it that Ukraine had to name dozens of their settlements the EXACT SAME NAME!!!
> "Russia captured Stepove!" 
> "Which one??"
Now we have what is probably the 20th Vesele coming up in Zaporizhzhia Oblast. Who named these, and why are they so unoriginal??

Also, as you may notice, just south of this new Vesele is the 50th Zelenyi Hai. Fascinating.

"Exclusively Ukrainian Weapons": Zelensky Demands West Speed Up Aid Amid Mutual Strikes
Russia and Ukraine exchanged large-scale strikes on each other's infrastructure and military targets on October 5-6. The Russian side continued to strike Ukrainian energy and fuel-logistics facilities, while Ukraine carried out a massive drone raid, during which, according to Russian data, 251 drones were shot down, predominantly over Crimea and the Black Sea waters.
In the context of these events, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy hinted at the expansion of domestic production capabilities, stating: "In recent days, to hit targets on Russian territory, Ukraine has been using exclusively Ukrainian products, and these are not just drones." He called on Western partners to allocate more funds for scaling up production.
Simultaneously, Zelenskyy criticized some European partners for the slow allocation of funds under the PURL program for weapons procurement...

Escalation In Northern Syria Reaches Aleppo City With Kurdish Forces Bracing For Battle (Videos)
Tensions between Syria‚Äôs Islamist-led Interim Government and the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) have reached the northern city of Aleppo, with reports suggesting that both sides were preparing for a possible battle there.
Government forces and SDF have been exchanging strikes near the town of Deir Hafer, which is located some 40 kilometers to the east of Aleppo, for the last few weeks.
Large reinforcements were deployed on both sides of the front there in recent days.
While a battle was expected to start near Deir Hafter, Aleppo itself became the focal point of the tensions on October 6 after government forces blocked all entrances to the Kurdish-majority neighborhoods of Sheikh Maqsoud and Ashrafieh, which are controlled by the SDF.
Read more

Deadly Clashes Between Government And Kurds In Aleppo City End With Fragile Ceasefire (Videos)
Fierce clashes broke out overnight in the northern Syrian city of Aleppo between the forces of the Islamist-led Interim Government and Kurdish forces affiliated with the Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF).
Tensions between the Interim Government and the SDF have been building up for weeks over the failure to implement the integration agreement signed last March. However, both sides have been amassing their forces near the town of Deir Hafter, some 40 kilometers to the east of Aleppo.
The situation in Aleppo itself remained calm up until October 6, when government forces blocked all entrances to the Kurdish-majority neighborhoods of Sheikh Maqsoud and Ashrafieh, which are under the de-facto control of the SDF.
Read more
